svg.content:
<mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:131.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/131.0" version="24.7.17"> <diagram name="Page-1" id="B2nPFR0EhPRXYeY-fItV"> <mxGraphModel dx="2848" dy="739" grid="1" gridSize="10" guides="1" tooltips="1" connect="1" arrows="1" fold="1" page="1" pageScale="1" pageWidth="827" pageHeight="1169" math="0" shadow="0"> <root> <mxCell id="0" /> <mxCell id="1" parent="0" /> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-1" value="IAM" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;strokeWidth=3;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="354" y="50" width="120" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-2" value="On prem " style="shape=umlFrame;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;pointerEvents=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=3;width=111;height=28;strokeColor=default;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fillColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="80" y="320" width="120" height="60" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-3" value="Cloud" style="shape=umlFrame;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;pointerEvents=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=3;width=111;height=28;strokeColor=default;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fillColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="510" y="180" width="460" height="430" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-4" value="Active directory" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="85" y="350" width="110" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-5" value="Entra ID" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="530" y="210" width="70" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-6" value="<div align="left"><ul><li><strong>Authentication</strong>: This includes verifying identity to<br/> access applications and resources. It also includes providing <br/>functionality such as self-service password reset, multifactor <br/>authentication, a custom list of banned passwords, and smart lockout <br/>services.</li><li><strong>Single sign-on</strong>: Single sign-on (SSO) enables you to<br/> remember only one username and one password to access multiple <br/>applications. A single identity is tied to a user, which simplifies the <br/>security model. As users change roles or leave an organization, access <br/>modifications are tied to that identity, which greatly reduces the <br/>effort needed to change or disable accounts.</li><li><strong>Application management</strong>: You can manage your cloud <br/>and on-premises apps by using Microsoft Entra ID. Features like <br/>Application Proxy, SaaS apps, the My Apps portal, and single sign-on <br/>provide a better user experience.</li><li><strong>Device management</strong>: Along with accounts for <br/>individual people, Microsoft Entra ID supports the registration of <br/>devices. Registration enables devices to be managed through tools like <br/>Microsoft Intune. It also allows for device-based Conditional Access <br/>policies to restrict access attempts to only those coming from known <br/>devices, regardless of the requesting user account.</li></ul></div>" style="text;html=1;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="520" y="245" width="440" height="340" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-7" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.467;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;entryPerimeter=0;strokeWidth=3;curved=0;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-1" target="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-2"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-9" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.543;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;entryPerimeter=0;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-1" target="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-3"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-11" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=link;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=-0.007;entryY=0.433;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;entryPerimeter=0;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-4" target="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-3"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-13" value="Micorosft entra connect" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="288" y="320" width="126" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-14" value="Microsoft domain service" style="shape=umlFrame;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;pointerEvents=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=3;width=130;height=40;strokeColor=default;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fillColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="-1060" y="190" width="980" height="350" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-15" value="<p>Microsoft Entra Domain Services is like a ready-made system that provides important features for managing computers and users in a network, without you having to set it up or maintain it yourself.</p><p>It helps you:</p><ul><li><strong>Connect computers to a network</strong> (domain join),</li><li><strong>Set rules for users and devices</strong> (group policy),</li><li><strong>Allow secure access to directories</strong> (LDAP),</li><li><strong>Handle secure logins</strong> (Kerberos/NTLM authentication).</li></ul><p>All of this works without you needing to worry about setting up or maintaining the servers (domain controllers) that usually provide these services. Microsoft takes care of all that for you in the cloud.</p>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="-1070" y="230" width="980" height="160" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-16" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;"><br></h1><p>When you create a Microsoft Entra Domain Services managed domain, you <br/>define a unique namespace. This namespace is the domain name. Two <br/>Windows Server domain controllers are then deployed into your selected <br/>Azure region. This deployment of DCs is known as a replica set.</p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="-1050" y="400" width="950" height="120" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-18" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=1;entryY=0.626;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;entryPerimeter=0;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-3" target="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-14"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-20" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" as="sourcePoint" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-34" value="FIDO2" <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-38" <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-39" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;entryX=0.465;entryY=-0.037;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;entryPerimeter=0;" edge="1" parent="1" source="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-41" target="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-55"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="630" y="1140" as="targetPoint" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-40" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;shape=connector;curved=0;rounded=1;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeColor=default;strokeWidth=3;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;endArrow=classic;flowAnimation=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-41"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="298" y="1150" as="targetPoint" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-41" value="External identities" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;strokeWidth=3;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="78" y="1020" width="120" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-42" value="<strong>Business to business (B2B) collaboration</strong> - Collaborate <br/>with external users by letting them use their preferred identity to <br/>sign-in to your Microsoft applications or other enterprise applications <br/>(SaaS apps, custom-developed apps, etc.). B2B collaboration users are <br/>represented in your directory, typically as guest users." style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="-430" y="1160" width="370" height="80" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-43" value="<strong>B2B direct connect</strong> - Establish a mutual, two-way trust <br/>with another Microsoft Entra organization for seamless collaboration. <br/>B2B direct connect currently supports Teams shared channels, enabling <br/>external users to access your resources from within their home instances<br/> of Teams. B2B direct connect users aren't represented in your <br/>directory, but they're visible from within the Teams shared channel and <br/>can be monitored in Teams admin center reports." style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="-272" y="1258" width="380" height="110" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-45" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="78" y="1228" width="160" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-50" value="Laptop authentication" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="88" y="1248" width="130" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-51" value="Authenticator app" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="392" y="1228" width="60" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-54" value="Pass key" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="392" y="1248" width="70" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-55" value="<strong>Microsoft Azure Active Directory business to customer (B2C)</strong>
 - Publish modern SaaS apps or custom-developed apps (excluding 
Microsoft apps) to consumers and customers, while using Azure AD B2C for
 identity and access management." style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="454" y="1148" width="400" height="80" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-57" value="Conditional access" style="shape=umlFrame;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;pointerEvents=0;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;strokeWidth=3;width=111;height=28;strokeColor=default;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;fillColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="780" y="750" width="573" height="270" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="tHIQw-f0cl09mBN5cJ_6-58" value="<ul><li>Require multifactor authentication (MFA) to access an application <br/>depending on the requester’s role, location, or network. For example, <br/>you could require MFA for administrators but not regular users or for <br/>people connecting from outside your corporate network.</li><li>Require access to services only through approved client <br/>applications. For example, you could limit which email applications are <br/>able to connect to your email service.</li><li>Require users to access your application only from managed devices. A<br/> managed device is a device that meets your standards for security and <br/>compliance.</li><li>Block access from untrusted sources, such as access from unknown or unexpected locations.</li></ul>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;fontFamily=Helvetica;fontSize=11;fontColor=default;labelBackgroundColor=default;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="807" y="798" width="520" height="190" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 16px; margin-left: 1425px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 109px; height: 1px; padding-top: 285px; margin-left: 1151px;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 176px; margin-left: 1635px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 366px; margin-left: 1592px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

ul.li:
Authentication: This includes verifying identity to
access applications and resources. It also includes providing
functionality such as self-service password reset, multifactor
authentication, a custom list of banned passwords, and smart lockout
services.

Single sign-on: Single sign-on (SSO) enables you to
remember only one username and one password to access multiple
applications. A single identity is tied to a user, which simplifies the
security model. As users change roles or leave an organization, access
modifications are tied to that identity, which greatly reduces the
effort needed to change or disable accounts.

Application management: You can manage your cloud
and on-premises apps by using Microsoft Entra ID. Features like
Application Proxy, SaaS apps, the My Apps portal, and single sign-on
provide a better user experience.

Device management: Along with accounts for
individual people, Microsoft Entra ID supports the registration of
devices. Registration enables devices to be managed through tools like
Microsoft Intune. It also allows for device-based Conditional Access
policies to restrict access attempts to only those coming from known
devices, regardless of the requesting user account.

switch.text: Authentication: This includes verifying identity to...

div.p: Microsoft Entra Domain Services is like a ready-made system that provides important features for managing computers and users in a network, without you having to set it up or maintain it yourself.

ul.li: Connect computers to a network (domain join),
Set rules for users and devices (group policy),

div.p: All of this works without you needing to worry about setting up or maintaining the servers (domain controllers) that usually provide these services. Microsoft takes care of all that for you in the cloud.

switch.text: Microsoft Entra Domain Services is like a ready-made system that provides important features for managing computers and users in a network, without you having to set it up or mai...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 948px; height: 1px; padding-top: 358px; margin-left: 22px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 116px; overflow: hidden;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p:
When you create a Microsoft Entra Domain Services managed domain, you
define a unique namespace. This namespace is the domain name. Two
Windows Server domain controllers are then deployed into your selected
Azure region. This deployment of DCs is known as a replica set.

switch.text: When you create a Microsoft Entra Domain Services managed domain, you...

div.div:
Business to business (B2B) collaboration - Collaborate
with external users by letting them use their preferred identity to
sign-in to your Microsoft applications or other enterprise applications
(SaaS apps, custom-developed apps, etc.). B2B collaboration users are
represented in your directory, typically as guest users.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1264px; margin-left: 988px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
B2B direct connect - Establish a mutual, two-way trust
with another Microsoft Entra organization for seamless collaboration.
B2B direct connect currently supports Teams shared channels, enabling
external users to access your resources from within their home instances
of Teams. B2B direct connect users aren't represented in your
directory, but they're visible from within the Teams shared channel and
can be monitored in Teams admin center reports.

switch.text: B2B direct connect - Establish a mutual, two-way trust...

div.div:
Microsoft Azure Active Directory business to customer (B2C)
- Publish modern SaaS apps or custom-developed apps (excluding
Microsoft apps) to consumers and customers, while using Azure AD B2C for
identity and access management.

switch.text: Microsoft Azure Active Directory business to customer (B2C)...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 109px; height: 1px; padding-top: 715px; margin-left: 1851px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 844px; margin-left: 2137px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;

ul.li:
Require multifactor authentication (MFA) to access an application
depending on the requester’s role, location, or network. For example,
you could require MFA for administrators but not regular users or for
people connecting from outside your corporate network.

Require access to services only through approved client
applications. For example, you could limit which email applications are
able to connect to your email service.

Require users to access your application only from managed devices. A
managed device is a device that meets your standards for security and
compliance.
Block access from untrusted sources, such as access from unknown or unexpected locations.

switch.text: Require multifactor authentication (MFA) to access an application...

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
